relieve somebody of something.translatio: to help someone by taking something from them, especially a job they do not want to do or something heavy that they are carrying
A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
He rose and relieved her of her bags.
to take away someone’s job because they have done something wrong
After the defeat General Meyer was relieved of his command.
to steal something from someone – used humorously
A couple of guys relieved him of his wallet.
to help someone by taking from them something that they find difficult or unpleasant
The transaction will relieve the company of $19.4 million in debt.
to take away someone’s job because they have done it badly or done something wrong
The film company has suspended production of the movie and relieved the director of his job.
